verses.verse: And Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>,
No doubt <WH551> but ye are the people <WH5971>, and wisdom <WH2451> shall die <WH4191> with you.

But <WH1571> I have understanding <WH3824> as well as you; I am not inferior <WH5307> to you: yea, who knoweth not such things <WH3644> as these? understanding: Heb. an heart I am: Heb. I fall not lower than you who: Heb. with whom are not such as these?
I am as one mocked <WH7814> of his neighbour <WH7453>, who calleth <WH7121> upon God <WH433>, and he answereth <WH6030> him: the just <WH6662> upright <WH8549> man is laughed to scorn <WH7814>.
He that is ready <WH3559> to slip <WH4571> with his feet <WH7272> is as a lamp <WH3940> despised <WH937> in the thought <WH6248> of him that is at ease <WH7600>.
The tabernacles <WH168> of robbers <WH7703> prosper <WH7951>, and they that provoke <WH7264> God <WH410> are secure <WH987>; into whose hand <WH3027> God <WH433> bringeth <WH935> abundantly.
But <WH199> ask <WH7592> now the beasts <WH929>, and they shall teach <WH3384> thee; and the fowls <WH5775> of the air <WH8064>, and they shall tell <WH5046> thee:
Or speak <WH7878> to the earth <WH776>, and it shall teach <WH3384> thee: and the fishes <WH1709> of the sea <WH3220> shall declare <WH5608> unto thee.
Who knoweth <WH3045> not in all these that the hand <WH3027> of the LORD <WH3068> hath wrought <WH6213> this?
In whose hand <WH3027> is the soul <WH5315> of every living thing <WH2416>, and the breath <WH7307> of all mankind <WH376> <WH1320>. soul: or, life all: Heb. all flesh of man
Doth not the ear <WH241> try <WH974> words <WH4405>? and the mouth <WH2441> taste <WH2938> his meat <WH400>? mouth: Heb. palate
With the ancient <WH3453> is wisdom <WH2451>; and in length <WH753> of days <WH3117> understanding <WH8394>.
With him is wisdom <WH2451> and strength <WH1369>, he hath counsel <WH6098> and understanding <WH8394>. With: that is, With God
Behold, he breaketh down <WH2040>, and it cannot be built again <WH1129>: he shutteth up <WH5462> a man <WH376>, and there can be no opening <WH6605>. up: Heb. upon
Behold, he withholdeth <WH6113> the waters <WH4325>, and they dry up <WH3001>: also he sendeth them out <WH7971>, and they overturn <WH2015> the earth <WH776>.
With him is strength <WH5797> and wisdom <WH8454>: the deceived <WH7683> and the deceiver <WH7686> are his.
He leadeth <WH3212> counsellors <WH3289> away spoiled <WH7758>, and maketh the judges <WH8199> fools <WH1984>.
He looseth <WH6605> the bond <WH4148> of kings <WH4428>, and girdeth <WH631> their loins <WH4975> with a girdle <WH232>.
He leadeth <WH3212> princes <WH3548> away spoiled <WH7758>, and overthroweth <WH5557> the mighty <WH386>.
He removeth away <WH5493> the speech <WH8193> of the trusty <WH539>, and taketh away <WH3947> the understanding <WH2940> of the aged <WH2205>. speech: Heb. lip of the faithful
He poureth <WH8210> contempt <WH937> upon princes <WH5081>, and weakeneth <WH7503> the strength <WH4206> of the mighty <WH650>. weakeneth: or, looseth the girdle of the strong
He discovereth <WH1540> deep things <WH6013> out of darkness <WH2822>, and bringeth out <WH3318> to light <WH216> the shadow of death <WH6757>.
He increaseth <WH7679> the nations <WH1471>, and destroyeth <WH6> them: he enlargeth <WH7849> the nations <WH1471>, and straiteneth <WH5148> them again. straiteneth: Heb. leadeth in

He taketh away <WH5493> the heart <WH3820> of the chief <WH7218> of the people <WH5971> of the earth <WH776>, and causeth them to wander <WH8582> in a wilderness <WH8414> where there is no way <WH1870>.
They grope <WH4959> in the dark <WH2822> without light <WH216>, and he maketh them to stagger <WH8582> like a drunken <WH7910> man. stagger: Heb. wander
